page.title: 02LANDSCAPE 2.
page.content: Until 1981 the whole estuary was tidal.At the head of the estuary known as Millbrook Lake,boats could only use this 3 hours either side of high tide.The lake area was dammed up in 1981 to stop the village flooding at very high tides.About 20% of the South foreshore is owned by Mrs.Gay,10% is owned by Lord Elliot and the rest by the Duchy of Cornwall.People have moored their boats for many years in Millbrook Lake paying the Duchy only small amounts. {THE ESTUARY}is owned 90% by the Duchy 10% by the Earl of Mt.Edgecombe up to Palmer point.Mr. P Patterson who lives at Foss Quay leases the foreshore from the Duchy so people who moor boats near his yard pay fees to him.He designs catarmarans.In 1985 the parish Council will take control of moorings above and below the dam.
